New Records: Zimbabwe defended the lowest total ever against India in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Ravi Bishnoi took four wickets to restrict Zimbabwe to 115/9.
Tendai Chatara and Sikandar Raza picked up three wickets each for Zimbabwe.
Sikandar Raza was named Player of the Match for his three-wicket haul.
Washington Sundar's efforts in the final over were not enough as India fell short by 13 runs.
India was bowled out for 102 in 19.5 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill won the toss and opted to bowl first on a pitch that looked dry.
Sikandar Raza emphasized the importance of taking one game at a time and improving skills.
Shubman Gill mentioned the need for the team to enjoy their batting and take time.
Post-Match Reflections: Sikandar Raza expressed happiness about the win and acknowledged the need for improvement.
Shubman Gill expressed disappointment with the team's fielding and his own dismissal.
Clive Madande reflected on the importance of giving 100% effort and protecting his partner during the innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was on the slower side, making it difficult for batters to score.
Zimbabwe's catching and ground fielding were praised despite some errors.
The crowd's support was credited for lifting the Zimbabwean team's energy.
